articles.title: New York City Companies Prepare to Put Pay Ranges on Job Listings - The Wall Street Journal
articles.description: A law requiring salary ranges on postings is slated to go into effect in May; managers see potential backlash from current employees.
articles.content:
New York City employers are hustling to figure out what to do about impending salary-disclosure rules, while hoping for a delay.
A sweeping pay-disclosure law requiring nearly all companies operatin… [+300 chars]
